alert.note: Alert for Escambia; Santa Rosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 15 at 11:48PM EDT until June 16 at 1:45AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CDT FRIDAY FOR SOUTHEASTERN ESCAMBIA AND SOUTH CENTRAL SANTA ROSA COUNTIES... At 1048 PM CDT, The public reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. Significant floding was reported along Ft. Pickens Road in Pensacola Beach and in Gulf Breeze. Continued heavy rain moving into the area will only increase the flash flooding potential along this area. Please stay off the roads. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pensacola, Warrington, Gulf Breeze, Goulding, Oriole Beach, Pensacola Beach, Villa Sabine, Brownsville, Garcon Point, Beach Haven and Pleasant Grove. This includes the following streams and drainages... Carpenter Creek, Pensacola Bay, Bridge Creek and Bellshead Branch. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
